title: Woman Defends Giving Pastor Kanyari Condoms During Church Service
text:
Home Entertainment Celebrities Celebrities Pastor Kanyari: Lady who Gifted Preacher Condoms in Church Unapologetic, Says She Did Nothing Wrong Friday, May 24, 2024 at 9:20 AM by Brian Ajon 2 min read Faith Mutindi gifted Pastor Kanyari a packet of condoms at the altar, which later created a significant online debate Mutindi defended her actions in an interview, emphasising the importance of promoting safe sex within the church Despite the backlash, she stated she would not apologise, arguing that pastors are often unfairly judged and need open discussions about safe practices PAY ATTENTION: Leave your feedback about TUKO.co.ke. During a recent Sunday service, an event occurred that sparked intense discussion and criticism across social media.
Faith Mutindi stands firm after giving Pastor Kanyari condoms in church. Photo: Pastor Kanyari, Trudi Kitui.
Source: Instagram Faith Mutindi presented Pastor Kanyari with a package at the church altar.
Upon unwrapping, it contained personal care items, including a Kotex liner, Arimis petroleum jelly, and a pack of condoms.
Why did Mutindi gift Pastor Kanyari condoms? The act was part of a larger statement by Mutindi, who openly shared her vision of marrying Pastor Kanyari and emphasised the need for him to practise safe sex , considering his popularity among women.

Pastor Kanyari Apologises after Entertaining Lady who Gifted Him Condoms in Church: "I'm Sorry"

"I see that women really want Pastor Kanyari. I have brought you protection. Use protection, daddy, do not reject women," she said. Faith Mutindi defends herself In a conversation with interviewer Trudy Kitui, Faith stood by her actions, stating that she believes the church needs individuals who can boldly speak on topics like safe sex education .
She also addressed the criticism she faced for giving such items to a religious leader, arguing that there should be no shame in discussing safe sex practices.
Mutindi mentioned that her gifts also included money and other items, but it was the personal care items that drew quick judgment from others.
"Pastors are going through a lot. They are the most judged people. Do you know pastors can't buy protectives from a chemist because of being judged? They are also humans; people shouldn't judge them... I didn't do anything wrong, and I won't apologise," she said. Read also
Ezekiel Mutua Slams Pastor Kanyari Over Online Misconduct, Vows to Stop Him: "Mockery to the Faith"
Subscribe to watch new videos Pastor Kanyari apologises after entertaining Faith Mutindi Earlier, the televangelist apologised to his church members and Kenyans at large for entertaining the lady.
The Salvation Healing Ministry founder said such an incident won't happen again.
He stated that he did not want to chase away Mutindi, fearing his congregation could have assaulted her.
